channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Marjorie Taylor Greene Has a Decision to Make
item.description: Her craziest-clown-at-the-carnival act seems to have descended into a sad clown party of one.

item.title: Russia Bombs Hardware Superstore in Kharkiv, Killing 11, Ukraine Says
item.description: It was the latest attack in a sustained bombing campaign that has made life increasingly dangerous for civilians in the northeastern Ukrainian city.

item.title: Ferrari 296 GTS Hybrid Review: ‘Arresting, uncanny beauty’ with $366,139 price tag
item.description: As Ferrari rolls toward its first all-electric car, arriving next year, it makes sense that it would also make a hybrid or two.

item.title: How Should We Honor the Dead of Our Failed Wars?
item.description: We owe it to the dead to remember what mattered to them, and the ideals they held, as well as how those ideals were betrayed.

item.title: Russia Strikes Hardware Superstore in Kharkiv
item.description: Ukrainian officials said at least 11 people were killed and dozens were injured in the latest bombing that has made life increasingly dangerous for civilians in the northeastern Ukrainian city.

item.title: Janet Yellen warns higher outlook for rates will make it harder to keep deficits and debt expenses under control
item.description: The White House sees 10-year Treasury yields at 3.7% in the early 2030s — almost a full percentage point higher than three years ago.

item.title: The Bitter Bargain that India’s 200 Million Muslims Face
item.description: In Modi’s Hindu-nationalist India, Muslims have to deny who we are.

item.title: Amateur Historians Heard Tales of a Lost Tudor Palace. Then, They Dug It Up.
item.description: In a small English village, a group of dedicated locals has unearthed the remains of a long-vanished palace that had been home to Henry VIII’s grandmother.

item.title: Could drugs like Ozempic and Wegovy help people live longer? Some experts see them as potential longevity pills
item.description: “The singular most effective and consistent way of extending lifespan in animals is caloric restriction.”

item.title: Trump Tells Libertarians to Nominate Him, and Mocks Them When They Boo
item.description: Former President Donald J. Trump’s appearance before the Libertarian Party on Saturday was without modern precedent: the presumptive nominee of one party addressing the convention of another.

item.title: Free Food? Modi Makes Sure Every Indian Knows Whom to Thank for It.
item.description: India’s welfare programs improve lives. Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s party uses its vast machinery to ensure the handouts also create loyal voters.

item.title: Tesla shareholders should reject Elon Musk’s ‘excessive’ pay package, proxy advisor says, noting ‘extraordinarily time-consuming projects’ unrelated to EV maker
item.description: “Mr. Musk’s slate of extraordinarily time-consuming projects unrelated to the Company was well-documented before the 2018 grant, and only expanded with his high-profile purchase of the company now known as X,” said Glass Lewis.

item.title: Hillary Clinton Has Some Tough Words for Democrats, and for Women
item.description: In an interview for a forthcoming book, Mrs. Clinton also suggested that if Donald Trump won in November “we may never have another actual election.”

item.title: Israel and Hamas Could Restart Cease-Fire Talks Within a Week, Officials Say
item.description: Negotiators held preliminary discussions in Paris this weekend, hoping to revive the possibility of a truce, the officials said.

item.title: Top assassin for the Sinaloa drug cartel, once described as ‘a complete psychopath’ with long history of gruesome acts, is extradited to U.S.
item.description: Nestor Isidro Pérez Salas, also known as “El Nini,” is a leader of a group that provided security for the sons of imprisoned drug lord Joaquín “El Chapo” Guzmán, federal investigators said.
